author: rodolfo.miranda
title: Vending Machine (MDB) interface
description: Les distributeurs automatiques n'acceptent pas les paiements en ADA

f6_assessments.q0:
Malheureusement, la proposition est un peu en dehors du champ du défi, car, même s'il s'agit d'une intégration du COTI AdaPay avec le protocole MDB pour les distributeurs automatiques, le briefing du défi mentionne explicitement que la cible doit être axée sur les sites Web de commerce électronique et non sur la vente physique.
Cela dit, je pense que le développement de cette proposition pourrait avoir un grand impact sur l'écosystème Cardano en général, et l'intégration d'ADA Pay avec les distributeurs automatiques physiques pourrait être le coup de pouce optimal pour l'adoption de Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
L'auteur de la proposition est un membre de la communauté bien connu et, d'après son profil Linkedin et les expériences antérieures réussies avec Catalyst, il semble probable qu'il puisse réaliser ce qu'il propose. En même temps, il serait extrêmement bon de fournir une référence spécifique au développeur mentionné pour fournir aux électeurs et aux membres de la communauté plus de détails sur ses compétences et ses connaissances sur les interfaces MDB (ce n'est pas un vrai problème, mais cela pourrait ajouter de la valeur à la proposition).
Le plan du projet est clairement décrit et il est divisé en éléments réalisables. Il serait bon de fournir plus de détails sur le coût horaire élevé indiqué.
Le succès de la proposition est défini de manière claire ainsi que les différents jalons qui composeront le projet.
f6_assessments.q2:
La proposition comprend un calendrier réaliste pour la livraison du projet et une définition du succès est claire et explicite : une DEMO fonctionnelle pour l'intégration de ADA Pay avec une passerelle MDB se produira dans 6 semaines à partir du début des travaux.
Les KPI indiqués et le mécanisme de combinaison de JIRA + Github pour suivre l'avancement du projet sont vraiment bons et peuvent fournir facilement à la communauté la capacité d'auditer le développement.
À mon avis, il serait bon d'ajouter quelques mesures liées au projet après la livraison (garder la trace du distributeur automatique qui met en œuvre le système développé, les transactions qui se produiront, etc), même si elle est hors de la portée définie de la proposition.
L'extension du champ d'application avec une stratégie pour l'adoption ultérieure de cette proposition pourrait être un bon moyen de compenser un léger décalage de la proposition par rapport au champ d'application du défi.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is well structured but has some limitations in terms of impact. Event thought it is true that taking the lead in this industry would be interesting to Cardano, at the same time it is an industry that is in decline and does not offer great potentials in the future because it has been consolidated for quite a while. Additionally, it somewhat dodges the main objective of the challenge. Instead of focusing on a plug-in to e-commerce it is targeting a slightly different market. Besides that, there are some points missing that would enhance the proposal. Concerns about quality of the integration, scalability, percentage of success in the transactions and a user-friendly experience are hardly touched in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Rodolfo has provided enough evidence of his skills and experience to signal he has the capacity to implement the proposal. The plan clearly breaks down the steps necessary to reach a successful conclusion and even though the workhours are slightly overpriced the overall budget is reasonable. The timetable shown is bit bold and fast-paced, but still acceptable. Additionally, the main risk identified is fairly discussed and in the worst-case scenario it would mean the project would take longer than expected. Also, in this case, the additional funding necessary would come from the original fund. In other words, it would be diluted.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress of the project. Great KPIs were defined that will help keep track of the pace of the plan. For every stage of the project there will be a KPI to assist this tracking. The roadmap built is well structured and the milestones are clearly defined. The time horizon sounds a bit short, what would mean the rhythm of work would be accelerated. The only point missing is KPIs regarding the success of the proposal. Ratio of transactions completed over total transactions, scalability without loss of quality and number of merchants that can be integrated are a few that would contribute a lot to the project.

f6_assessments.q0: 5 - When people propose payment systems we automatically gravitate to online e-commerce systems and the number of the COTI challenge proposals are exactly off this mould. So a proposal to improve upon payment gateways in the physical world will indeed stand out. Vending machines are a common feature in any environment around the world so targeting this ubiquitous furniture is riding the new (crypto) with the old (the vending machines). The value of vending machine usage and sales (in the US alone as quoted) suggests this proposal falls perfectly within the challenge and would be a boon to both Cardano and COTI if successfully accomplished. Featuring an 'Accepts ADA/COTI" sticker on vending machines will also serve was additional marketing that could propagate the brands to people who are unaware. I completely agree this falls in the right challenge in more ways than one.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer Rodrigo seems to have the education and work qualifications suitable to tackle this project, and additionally, builds in the same payment processing space. Furthermore, he is not new to Catalyst having had a proposal funded in F6 so he has awareness of the requirements and information necessary to move forward. H e also seems to be an active and contributing member of the Cardano Community and lends his expertise as required. The plan the proposer has laid out has been simplified enough for the average person to understand and track. His description of each stage of the 6-week project is concise and is supported by breakdowns in hours and more importantly, costs for each part of the journey. For a former assessor of tenders for a university, these are elements that give confidence of potential success. The fact that it is a short project also helps measure successes by the KPIs provided. There's not much I can suggest to improve this proposal except to say good luck. I for one am looking forward to being able to buy something at my local vending machine with ADA.
f6_assessments.q2: One of the more difficult things to convey in a proposal is the plan and how it will be executed, in a simple and easy to digest format. This enables a voter to properly vet a project to warrant a vote, knowing its trajectory if funded, can be audited and validate the expenditure. This proposal has laid out a very easy to understand 6-week plan with each step explained and costed, and measures for success elaborated enough that measuring it should be easy. It also indicates use of GitHub which allows for auditability by anyone.  What further lifts this proposal is the recognition of the risk of the MDP development and the potential on-boarding of a specialist if needed, also contained within the budget. Overall, I agree with its auditability and I expect great success in accomplishing its goals. Good luck.

f6_assessments.q0:
I disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge. This proposal, however, is well written but technically challenging tasks unfortunately. must be aligned with the goals of the challenge settings. 

The proposal mentions about how vending machines are in US market quite a big revenue stream, but i do not see a direct impact of this unless crypto goes mainstream in America. The difference between vending machines and an ecommerce platform is that it is location independent. As an example in India, you will rarely find any vending machine (except airports). However, you will find big ecommerce platforms where people are running small and medium scale business while also competing with the likes of amazon. 

Therefore, the immediate focus of this challenge is to integrate AdaPay with such platforms to immediate reach a much larger user base. Even if 5% of that user base are using crypto as payment, this will result into a huge traffic on Coti/Cardano network.

With all these reasonings, i still believe this is a good idea, but perhaps more suitable at some other challenge and not here. Because in my opinion goal of this setting is not just to make use of AdaPay but to integrate with different ecommerce software .

f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has provided us with evidence of the relevant skills needed for the proposal. He has been building experience in the field of engineering and has been in de vending sector for the last 15 years. This gives us full confidence that the proposer knows what he is talking about. The roadmap provided is solid but the deadlines are short. Since the proposer has a full-time job this project is filling up spare time and given the numbers in the proposal this takes about 25h/week which is a lot. On the other hand, the budget breakdown is well constructed and gives feedback on where the funds are requested for although $100/h is something to expect of a full-time job instead of a project in spare time.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer supplies us with the necessary pointers to give us evidence of engagement and feedback towards the community. By providing sprint burndown we get an estimate of how much time is still needed for the phase the project is in. A surplus is the risk assessment that is available in the proposal which is needed for this application.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to develop an interface that makes vending machines accept payments in ADA. In my opinion, the author clearly understands the challenge goals, he is competent, motivated, and shows profound engagement with Project Catalyst and Cardano ecosystem. The proposal demonstrates that the author can deliver on the desired product (the interface that can communicate ADA Pay with the Multi-Drop Bus (MDB) protocol which used in traditional vending machines), and that the product can contribute to the growth of Cardano ecosystem. Therefore, I strongly agree this proposal is impactful.
